info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Robeson and northwestern Bladen Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 319 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elrod, or 13 miles south of Red Springs, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Pembroke, St. Pauls, Rowland, Rex, Howellsville, Raemon, Tolarsville, Duart, Buie, Robeson Community College, Tobermory, Barker Ten Mile, Purvis, Prospect, Elrod, Jerome, Parkton, Rennert and Tar Heel. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 20 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern North Carolina.
